text:
AR 6. Impacts on the undertaking’s own workforce can originate in its strategy or business model
in a number of different ways. For example, impacts may relate to the undertaking’s value
proposition (such as providing lowest cost products or services, or high-speed delivery, in
ways that put pressure on labour rights in its own operations), or its cost structure and the
revenue model (such as shifting inventory risk to suppliers, with knock-on effects on the
